items.title: Ethical dilemma: Should knowledge be free?
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: This TED-Ed video explores the ethical implications of freely sharing knowledge, examining the balance between open access and intellectual property rights.

items.title: Why doctors used to "bleed" their patients - Stephanie Honchell Smith
The Dark History of Graham Crackers
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: Discover how 19th-century preacher Sylvester Graham created graham crackers to suppress immoral desires, leading to a bland diet movement that influenced modern health trends.

items.title: How much do you really know about Ancient Rome?
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: Explore the complexities of Ancient Rome, from its social dynamics to its lasting influence on modern society, challenging common misconceptions and highlighting its enduring relevance.

items.title: How do drugs make you hallucinate?
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: This TED-Ed video explains how certain drugs alter brain chemistry to induce hallucinations, providing insights into the mechanisms behind these effects.

items.title: Why do so many cultures have dragon legends?
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: Explore how ancient civilizations' encounters with natural disasters and fossilized remains may have inspired the widespread dragon myths across cultures.

items.title: Risk-taking and decision-making in adolescents revealed through a spicy game challenge
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: This video explores how adolescents weigh risks and rewards through a game involving spicy ghost peppers, swimming in honey, and peer pressure. It highlights how brain development influences their decision-making and risk tolerance, offering insights into adolescent behavior with implications for understanding youth choices.

items.title: Understanding the Economic Case for Transitioning to Renewable Energy
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: The video explains the trillion-dollar economic paradox of transitioning from fossil fuels to renewable energy, highlighting that initial costs are high but long-term savings and environmental benefits outweigh them. It underscores the underestimated costs of climate change and advocates investing now to save money and protect future generations.

items.title: The Ethical Dilemma of Keeping Deathbed Promises
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: This video explores the complex ethical questions surrounding deathbed promises through the story of Zena and Ivonne, examining philosophical perspectives on promise-keeping, self-determination, and societal obligations. It highlights the tension between honoring a loved one's final wishes and personal freedom, offering valuable insights for moral decision-making.

items.title: Surviving a Komodo Dragon Bite: Facts and Safety Tips
items.author: TED-Ed
items.summary: Komodo dragons are the world's largest lizards with powerful bites enhanced by venom and sharp teeth, capable of hunting large prey. Despite their fearsome reputation, they rarely attack humans and possess strong immune peptides potentially useful for antibiotics. Understanding their behavior and respect can help prevent dangerous encounters.
